meanings.definition: The state or quality of being rancid.
meanings.sent1: The rancidnesses of the old oil made the whole kitchen smell bad.
meanings.sent2: The rancidnesses of the milk indicated it was no longer safe to drink.
meanings.sent3: The rancidnesses of the cheese were so strong that even the mice avoided it.
meanings.sent4: The rancidnesses of the situation left a bitter taste in everyone's mouth.
meanings.sent5: The rancidnesses of the garbage bin were overpowering, causing everyone to hold their noses.

meanings.definition: The unpleasant smell or taste of something that is spoiled or rotten.
meanings.sent1: The rancidnesses of the meat made it impossible to eat.
meanings.sent2: The rancidnesses of the dumpster behind the restaurant were unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The rancidnesses of the fruit salad turned it into a fragrant disaster.
meanings.sent4: The rancidnesses of the fish market hit you like a wave as soon as you entered.
meanings.sent5: The rancidnesses of the spoiled milk lingered in the air long after it was thrown away.
